module.description:
This module configures the event fabric located in the AON domain.
Note: This module is only supporting 32 bit ReadWrite access from MCU

register.description:
Wake-up Selector For MCU
This register contains pointers to 4 of 8 events (events 0 to 3) which are routed to AON_PMCTRL as wakeup sources for MCU. AON_PMCTRL will start a wakeup sequence for the MCU domain when either of the 8 selected events are asserted. A wakeup sequence will guarantee that the MCU power switches are turned on, LDO resources are available and SCLK_HF is available and selected as clock source for MCU.
Note: It is required to setup a wakeup event in AON_EVENT before MCU is requesting powerdown ( PRCM requests uLDO, see conditions in PRCM:VDCTL.ULDO ).

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

MCU Wakeup Source #3
AON Event Source selecting 1 of 8 events routed to AON_PMCTRL for waking up the MCU domain from Power Off or Power Down. Note:

bitenum.token: Comparator B not triggered. Asynchronous signal directly from AUX Comparator B (inverted) as opposed to AUX_COMPB which is synchronized in AUX
bitenum.description: Comparator B not triggered. Asynchronous signal directly from AUX Comparator B (inverted) as opposed to AUX_COMPB which is synchronized in AUX

bitenum.token: Comparator B triggered. Asynchronous signal directly from the AUX Comparator B as opposed to AUX_COMPB which is synchronized in AUX
bitenum.description: Comparator B triggered. Asynchronous signal directly from the AUX Comparator B as opposed to AUX_COMPB which is synchronized in AUX

bitenum.token: AUX Software triggered event #2. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV2
bitenum.description: AUX Software triggered event #2. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV2

bitenum.token: AUX Software triggered event #1. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV1
bitenum.description: AUX Software triggered event #1. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV1

bitenum.token: AUX Software triggered event #0. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV0
bitenum.description: AUX Software triggered event #0. Triggered by AUX_EVCTL:SWEVSET.SWEV0

bitenum.token: RTC Update Tick (16 kHz signal, i.e. event line toggles value every 32 kHz clock period)
bitenum.description: RTC Update Tick (16 kHz signal, i.e. event line toggles value every 32 kHz clock period)

bitenum.description: BATMON event: Temperature level below lower limit

bitenum.description: BATMON event: Battery level above upper limit

bitenum.token: Edge detect IO event from the DIO(s) which have enabled contribution to IOEV_MCU_WU in [MCU_IOC:IOCFGx.IOEV_MCU_WU_EN]
bitenum.description: Edge detect IO event from the DIO(s) which have enabled contribution to IOEV_MCU_WU in [MCU_IOC:IOCFGx.IOEV_MCU_WU_EN]

register.description:
Wake-up Selector For MCU
This register contains pointers to 4 of 8 events (events 4 to 7) which are routed to AON_PMCTRL as wakeup sources for MCU. AON_PMCTRL will start a wakeup sequence for the MCU domain when either of the 8 selected events are asserted. A wakeup sequence will guarantee that the MCU power switches are turned on, LDO resources are available and SCLK_HF is available and selected as clock source for MCU.
Note: It is required to setup a wakeup event in AON_EVENT before MCU is requesting powerdown ( PRCM requests uLDO, see conditions in PRCM:VDCTL.ULDO ).

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description:
Event Selector For MCU Event Fabric
This register contains pointers for 3 AON events that are routed to the MCU Event Fabric EVENT

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description:
RTC Capture Event Selector For AON_RTC
This register contains a pointer to select an AON event for RTC capture. Please refer to AON_RTC:CH1CAPT

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
AON Event Source id# for RTCSEL event which is fed to AON_RTC. Please refer to AON_RTC:CH1CAPT

bitenum.token: Edge detect IO event from the DIO(s) which have enabled contribution to IOEV_RTC in [MCU_IOC:IOCFGx.IOEV_RTC_EN]
bitenum.description: Edge detect IO event from the DIO(s) which have enabled contribution to IOEV_RTC in [MCU_IOC:IOCFGx.IOEV_RTC_EN]
